title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.2: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) COORDINATION&MONITORG

description.narrative: By 2020, the Ministries in charge of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene, as well as the local authorities of the target regions, have enhanced capacities for coordination, planning and monitoring including in case of emergency., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end 2020, women, adolescents and children including the most vulnerable utilize equitable and sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services in rural areas in times of stability and crisis.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the Ministries in charge of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene, as well as the local authorities of the target regions, haveenhanced capacities for coordination, planning and monitoring including in case of emergency.

description.narrative: The online Integrated Planning, Monitoring, and Evaluation System for Drinking Water was finalized and launched in 2020 to facilitate the monitoring of the sub-sector’s performance. As part of its response to emergencies, the Country Office provided WASH services to over 449,650 and 379,000 people vulnerable to the COVID-19 pandemic, to 200 people affected by floods, and to 650 internally displaced households during the electoral crisis | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:26/01/2021
